--- In gladiator@egroups.com, Tom Ricket <tricket@h...> wrote:
> 
> >look I know this has been beaten to death, but I was wondering does
> >anyone have a copy of gladiators:BF.  I figured I would post even 
if
> >I didn't own the registered game.  I know this game is awesome and 
I
> >like it alot, but I am hesitant at paying 10 dollars(as small as 
the
> >amount may seem) for anything whose development is halted.  Please 
do
> >not respond and assume this is some kind of a plea for a password,
> >this is just my opinoun.
> 
> Hiya! (Figured I'd send this to the list as well)

Technically work on the game has halted.  The only work being done is 
people like Tevildo and myself making new scenarios to play.

> 
> The lack of having G:BF out there is definitely my fault -- people 
have 
> been asking for it for many months, but between hard drive crashes, 
my 
> day-job, and lots of other little things, I haven't had a chance to 
get it 
> re-posted recently :(
> 
> I do have an out-of-date version here on my hard drive -- it doesn't 
have 
> the fixes/features of the more recent versions, but I suppose it's 
better 
> than nothing.  The file is about 18 megs in size, I think -- here, 
I'll put 
> a link to it at:
>          http://24.2.87.94/GladAlpha.zip
> 

Ok, one quick question.  Will the same scenario editor for Gladiator 
work for G:BF?  If so, what scenario numbers will be open?  Can anyone 
of us registered users create some scenarios that will be pre-included 
 in the G:BF?  If so, I might be willing to work on some 'normal' 
scenarios for the future game.
